data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 1,978,439 believers in Gyeonggi-do to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Gyeonggi-do, South Korea

data.prayer: Lord, make the 1,978,439 believers in Gyeonggi-do to be brave and clear with the gospel to their 10,114,560 neighbors.
data.verse: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

data.prayer: Jesus, please bless the leaders of the the state of Gyeonggi-do, South Korea who work hard at shepherding and guiding your people.
data.verse: With upright heart he shepherded them and guided them with his skillful hand.

data.prayer: Father, you said, "The earth belongs to Me and all that is in it". Please, call Gyeonggi-do, South Korea into obedience and eternal life.
data.verse: The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

data.prayer: Lord, please remember the Turk people. you said you wanted worshippers of every tongue and tribe and nation, yet we know of no worshippers among them.
Father, as people seek answers on the internet, please help them find the gospel in Gyeonggi-do, South Korea.
data.verse: So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the church in the state of Gyeonggi-do to increase their prayer for your kingdom to come.
data.verse: Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God...

data.prayer: Jesus, protect the vulnerable in Gyeonggi-do, South Korea from the evil one.
data.verse: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.

location.name: Gyeonggi-do
location.people_groups_list: Kazakh, Malay, South Asian, general, Thai, Khmer
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Kazakh (12,000), Malay (9,600), South Asian, general (101,000), Thai (102,000), Khmer (46,000)
